review: Great entertainment center.  Using this box with Prime, and a Netflix membership is the way to go for media on demand.  The menue structure and search function takes a little getting used to, but with a little trial and error you will be flying through your apps, and checking out all the free prime videos in no time.My 9 year old loves all the fun apps and shows she has found to watch on the Disney channel on Sling TV.  I have a hard time getting the remote back from her most days.
author: Fletcher

review: Easy to use with no problems. Just hooked it up, logged in and watched my favorite shows
author: Amazon Customer

review: I got rid of the $100/month fee to my cable company for the $99/year Prime.  I am disappointed that so many of the shows I want to watch have a fee, but I have been able to find enough to watch without the extra fees.  I am happy that  I got the fire tv.
author: Trisha

review: Please CANCEL my FREE subscription.  Obviously I misunderstood.  I have to pay.
author: Dorothy

review: Amazon Fire is so much better than google Chromecast. We LOVE it!  It is so user friendly!  There is almost never a delay.  It is awesome!  It has made streaming so much more enjoyable! It is super easy to set up and use. It is a really good product and I wish we'd bought one for our household a year ago.  We bought one for the living room and then a week later we loved it so much that we bought a second for the master bedroom.  It is a great way to stream and alternative to cable.
author: Shoe Maven

review: Simple for anyone to install and use.  I'm not a techie, and I'm 70--and I installed it by myself and have used it for some of my favorites, including the Roosevelt series, Downton Abbey, British mysteries, and lots of factual programs.

review: When our satellite misfunctioned, a friend brought her Amazon Fire for us to use until our system could be repaired.  After my husband learned to use it, he fell in love with it - I knew we had to get one also.  He watches several shows/movies a day using the Amazon Fire (totally retired).  I understand that the Amazon Fire can also handle Netflix streaming - considering that also.  May have to buy a second system so that I can use it too.
